meanings.definition: To tie the hands and feet of a person together behind their back.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was hogtying the thief to prevent escape.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to hogtie the criminal to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy robber attempted hogtying himself and ended up tangled.
meanings.sent4: In the game of tag, the kids were hogtying each other to be 'it'.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick by hogtying himself and escaping in seconds.

meanings.definition: The act of restraining someone by tying their hands and feet together behind their back.
meanings.sent1: The hogtying of the suspect was necessary for transport.
meanings.sent2: The escape artist demonstrated a skillful hogtying technique.
meanings.sent3: During the team-building exercise, they tried hogtying as a trust fall alternative.
